doc.previous: The atom is also the smallest entity that can be envisaged to retain the chemical properties of the element such as electronegativity ionization potential preferred oxidation state s coordination number and preferred types of bonds to form e g metallic ionic covalent
doc.after: A chemical element is a pure substance which is composed of a single type of atom characterized by its particular number of protons in the nuclei of its atoms known as the atomic number and represented by the symbol Z The mass number is the sum of the number of protons and neutrons in a nucleus Although all the nuclei of all atoms belonging to one element will have the same atomic number they may not necessarily have the same mass number atoms of an element which have different mass numbers are known as isotopes For example all atoms with 6 protons in their nuclei are atoms of the chemical element carbon but atoms of carbon may have mass numbers of 12 or 13 41
